data.title: Best Coffee in Town
data.text: This is a great place to hang out with a friend on a rainy afternoon. The staff are friendly and accommodating. Excellent sandwiches and tasty baked goods but I come for the coffee and ambiance. No pretentious names like grande this or that - just down-to-earth people and good food.

data.title: Good coffee and eats, but should be better; too loud
data.text: Waltham really needed a good independent coffeeshop.  We finally got a a Starbucks (in fact 2), but Starbucks sucks.  The funny thing is the owner of Cafe on the Common tried to open a Starbucks but corporate in Seattle did not like the demographics of Waltham -- fools!  I digress.  Fast forward to opening an independent.  Hooray, raise the flags, oh but it's really not that pleasant.  First of all, Waltham has a thousand artists, and the art on the walls at the cafe is Posters - nice photos but still.  Secondly, the place is way too loud - all hard materials and a very reverberant room.  I still go occasionally,  but generally only to take out.  Waltham still needs a good independent.  More than Words has a nice atmosphere, but not interesting food or coffee.  Or Cafe on the Common can add some absorption to the walls and ceiling and hire nicer staff (but that's a separate rant).

data.title: Good food, not a good value.
data.text: A classical soup and sandwich and coffee place, all of it is very good, fresh and delicious and healthy, but expensive for what it is. Service could also be slow and inattentive, as forgetting your order.

data.title: Fabulous coffe
data.text: Called in here to fuel up before driving back to Vermont and had the best coffee. Yes, I'm a coffee snob (being an Aussie) and was delighted to see an "Aussie" coffee on the menu - which translates to a flat white. A nice strong coffee - not bitter,  with steamed milk and minimal froth. Our server Maggie was the best. The baked goods were delicious too. Will definitely be back next time we're in town.

data.title: Fresh and delicious
data.text: There are not many coffee shops in Waltham.  This has great coffee, sandwiches and wonderful desserts.  Staff friendly and plenty of room to sit.

data.title: Great local cafe with great vibe
data.text: I finally stopped into this unpretentious local place on a recent Sunday afternoon, and I'm so glad I did.  It is very low key, which I appreciate.  It's not a Panera or a Starbuck's, which feel artificial to me.  Mostly tables for two, but a couple of loveseat-style sofas, tile floor with runners.  Good dark roast coffee, as well as cappuccinos, lattes.  Went back two days later and enjoyed a slice of quiche followed by coffee.  Great selection of sweets, bottled water and juices, plus lots more on the menu, including salads.  I spent time working on a personal project and really enjoyed myself in this local spot.    Can't put my finger on why this place feels right, but it does.  I will definitely return.

data.title: Decent place to camp out and get some work done
data.text: I spent a morning there a few months ago when I needed a place with wifi and coffee and "Cafe on the Common" served that purpose. I did not eat anything, but I have eaten there in the past. It is not my first choice of restaurants in Waltham, but if you are looking for a place to sit down and not be bothered for a while, this will work. The coffee was average, but the fact that they offer different size ceramic mugs is a plus.

data.title: Plain old coffee shop
data.text:
I love supporting local business but there has to be something special. Cafe on the common made me yearn for Starbucks. 
Coffee wasn't great, steel chairs were more patio than comfortable and the service was lacking. Better places around Waltham. Nothing to see here.

data.title: Adored this cafe!
data.text: Skip the long line at Joseph's II and come here! Or maybe don't come here and spoil the relaxed atmosphere of this cafe. :)  It was so perfect that my husband and I returned the next morning for more coffee and breakfast.  Their quiches are worth skipping the scones.  Their other pastries looked delicious, and I'm wishing I had tried them.  And I was SO pleased to see that the coffees were fair trade!  All walks of life seemed to enjoy this charming cafe, and I can see why the appeal is so widespread.  Try it, you won't be disappointed!

data.title: Great place for a relaxing cup of Joe
data.text: Non pretentious is how I'd describe this neighborhood coffee house. Coffee was made by two very friendly gentlemen who greeted you with a smile and quick service. Try their baked goods. Heavenly!

data.title: Хороший выбор чая
data.text:
Были в этом кафе в подругой. Зашли просто так и не пожалели: помимо кофе, здесь отличный выбор чая! Что очень неожиданно для кафе. 
Есть несколько видов выпечки, не более.
